STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 21, 2023
Jennifer McMahon
Jackson House
2721 S. Washington Ave #1,
Lansing, MI, 48910
Re: License #: CI330410650
Dear Ms. McMahon:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 11/08/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
(989) 264-9217.
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility
after discharge.
One out of one applicable discharged youth did not have services that will be
provided by the facility documented in their discharge paperwork.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan

(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical and dental
follow up that is needed, have been reviewed
with the resident and with the parent and with
the responsible case manager.
One out of one applicable discharged youth did not have documentation showing
that the discharge recommendations were reviewed with the applicable parties.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(2) For an unplanned discharge, an institution shall
provide a brief summary or other documentation of
the circumstances surrounding the discharge.
One out of one applicable discharged youth did not have documentation outlining
the circumstances of their unplanned discharge.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• No technical assistance was provided during this inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was provided during this inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Financial information was provided and reviewed, and no concerns were noted
about the organization.

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator report was received and reviewed. Previous non-
compliance from beyond this reporting period was reviewed, as well as the
program's evolution into a new building over the summer of 2023.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during the unannounced, face-to-face visit on 11/08/2023.
Staff reported positive experiences working for the program and detailed how the
new building was of benefit to the youth and staff.
Youth placed were interviewed over video conference on 12/20/2023. They stated
that they have enjoyed their time in the program, feel safe and well cared for and
have experienced positive effects on their relationship with family because of the
program's involvement in their life.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Building was toured during the unannounced, face-to-face visit on 11/08/2023.
The building was in a clean and safe condition. Staff were excited to show new
aspects of the property. Rooms were toured and safety items, cleaning supplies
and medications were noted as stored properly.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
12/20/2023
